page.title: 03REFORMATION
page.content: Atherstone did not escape the results of great changes in the 16th century. Wealthy families bought monastic lands after the suppression of Merevale Abbey and town friary which at that time were owned by Mount Grace Abbey in Yorkshire The availibility of extra land alleviated the problems of a growing population.600 inhabitants occupied 135 houses built along the Watling Street (now known as Long St)and Market Place. At the end of the century the density of population had increased by 50%.This created more of a food problem and the reoccurrence of epidemics.Atherstone lost a large number of its population in 1558-9 with influenza.Also in 1604 probably the plague killed 145 people and many local families disappeared from records after this date.
